comment.author: 33722706@N04
comment._content:
Indeed this was the original "P" st. bridge which was replaced in 1935 at the same time that the Calvert St. bridge was replaced. The streetcar on the bridge operated from Lincoln Park through downtown and along Connecticut Ave.then west at Dupont Circle onto P street which was double tracked  from the circle to 28th st. The narrow street grid pattern of most Georgetown streets began west of 28th st. which routed the P street carline west on P st. and east on Dumbarton st.  The carline returned on O st to Wisconsin Ave to Dumbarton st to 28th to return eastbound on P st. to Dupont Circle.

The conduit streetcar trackage still extant, to the best of my knowledge, in sections of  P and O Steets west of Wisconsin Avenue was originally the western end of the P Street streetcar route. In 1936-37 a major track reconstruction and rerouting project resulted in the elimination of the P Street and Dumbarton street trackage between Wisconsin Ave. and Dupont Circle with service thereafter provided by buses.  The P and O street trackage west of Wisconsin Ave continued to be used until 1960 by the DC Transit Company's route 20 streetcars to Glen Echo Park and Cabin John Maryland.

comment._content: Very interesting details -- I salute you all for your knowledge and interest in the P Street Bridge.  By the way, as President, George Washington and his coach and servants forded Rock Creek directly under the (future) P Street Bridge on his trips between Mt. Vernon and the US capital--first, New York; then Philadelphia.  His successor, John Adams, was the first President, though only for a year, in the new capital, Washington, DC,
